Dialogue.NPCText:
A tall, spectral woman stands before you, wrapped in shadowy silks and ancient leather. A cloak like faded midnight shrouds her shoulders; her eyes, pale as desert ghosts, miss nothing.

Her voice is soft, edged with the memory of war:

“You tread Qasaria’s golden dust, stranger, yet your steps sound hollow. I am Zara, once called the Ghost Blade. Some say I have no nation, no master—only scars and stories.”

She rests her gloved hand on a sheathed dagger whose metal seems to shimmer with spirit-light.

“So. What is it you want from the blade that serves no banner?”

Option.text: Are you truly the legendary Ghost Blade of the Sands?
I heard you fought Minax’s knight and lived.
Do you have work for a mercenary?
Why do you linger in Qasaria, not at war?
Tell me more about yourself, Zara.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara’s lips twitch in a half-smile.

“Once, the name ‘Ghost Blade’ drew fear from Trinsic to Wind. I served in a hundred armies, none for long. In battle, all blood runs the same color.
Here in Qasaria, I find neither glory nor cause—only secrets. And old blades... like mine, lost and restless.”

“If you seek tales, I can share those. But steel and spirits are dearer to me.”

Option.text: Do you know the Council of Jewels?
Do you have work for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She leans against a ruined pillar, eyes far away.

“I once crossed blades with the Shadowspawn—Minax’s knight, a thing of void and pain, who killed for pleasure alone. It was beneath the moons at Skara Brae. We fought from dusk to dawn. In the end, I did not kill him, but I made him bleed. He carries the mark still, I am told.
Since then, Minax’s servants have hunted me. I live, but not for vengeance.”

“Battle is memory, nothing more.”

Option.text: Do you know the Council of Jewels?
Do you have work for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her eyes grow colder.

“I seek a sword named *Dust-Eater*. Spirit-forged in the time of the Desert Ancients, quenched in the tears of ghosts. It is no ordinary weapon—it drinks sorrow, and sings only in honest hands.

I lost it beneath Qasaria’s oldest tomb, fleeing Minax’s cultists and the Ash Serpents. I left a piece of my soul there. I have scoured every ruin, but dark magic clouds the path.”

“If you are bold—or foolish—enough, bring it to me. The sword chooses its bearer.”

Option.text: What’s in it for me if I return Dust-Eater?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara nods grimly.

“Seek the Obsidian Descent, at the city’s edge—an old catacomb where the dead of Qasaria’s first kings sleep. The sword lies deep, behind three sealed gates: one of sand, one of spirits, one of sorrow. Only the worthy pass.
Beware the Ash Serpents—they serve no master but chaos.”

“If you find Dust-Eater, do not draw it without cause.”

Option.text: What do I gain for this?
I’ll return when I have Dust-Eater.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her voice turns cold.

“The tomb is haunted by the **Ash Serpents**, nomads twisted by Minax’s magic. They burn what they cannot steal, worshiping dust and flame. Worse still, the tomb’s spirits hunger for the living. I fought them, once. They nearly took me.”

“If you face them, do not show fear—or they will taste it.”

Option.text: What do I gain for this?
Tell me of the Council of Jewels.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara’s gaze sharpens.

“Bring me Dust-Eater, and you may claim coin, lore, or the Ghost Blade’s service. I do not serve for long, but my blade has changed fates before.
Fail me—or betray me—and I become your shadow. Few survive being hunted by Zara.”

“Make your choice. I do not offer twice.”

Option.text: I want your loyalty—become my companion.
I want the Dust-Eater for myself.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She draws a faint line on her palm, blood mixing with spirit-light.

“Then it is sworn. Until fate parts us, the Ghost Blade is yours to command. But know this—my loyalty is to honor, not orders. Betray me, and you’ll see why ghosts never rest.”
[Zara the Ghost Blade may now join you as a companion.]

She tosses a heavy pouch of coins, eyes gleaming.

“Spend it wisely. As for secrets: the Council of Jewels is not what it seems. Watch Karim al-Emerald—he plays a long, deadly game with Minax and the Undermarket. Trust no shadows in Qasaria.”
[You have earned gold and forbidden lore!]

Her eyes turn to ice.

“Then we are foes. I will take back what is mine, by shadow or steel. Pray our paths never cross in darkness.”
[Zara will hunt you as a deadly bounty hunter!]

“Qasaria is a city of masks. The Council of Jewels glitter in public, but draw knives in the dark. I trust none of them. Rafiq al-Ruby boasts of honor, but sells his sword for secrets. Safiya al-Sapphire would trade her own shadow for profit. Karim al-Emerald—watch him. He smiles with poison.

I remain because the city is old, restless. There is war here, hidden beneath the gold.”

Option.text: Do you know the Council of Jewels?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I have crossed paths with each. Fought for Rafiq, guarded Safiya’s caravans, even spied for Karim in darker times. None own my loyalty, nor do I seek their favor.
If you wish to survive Qasaria, play the Council against each other. But never let them play you.”

Option.text: Enough politics. What of your quest?

Dialogue.NPCText: “Rafiq was once a true warlord—his honor outweighed his ambition. Now? He worries more for Qasaria’s wealth than her soul. Still, if you need steel, his cavalry answer. For a price.”
“Safiya would sell sand in the desert and water in a flood. She loves profit and hates rivals. If you cross her, beware her spies—and her gold. I have guarded her caravans, but never her secrets.”

Zara’s tone darkens.
“Karim is more shadow than man. He knows too much—about the Undermarket, Minax, even me. If you value your life, never bargain with him unless you know the blade at your own throat.”
“He is dangerous. As am I.”

“I have little use for hired swords, but much for bold souls. Find my spirit-forged blade—*Dust-Eater*—in the tombs beneath Qasaria. Return it, and I will reward you beyond gold.
Or… if you wish a simpler coin-task, I know Qasaria’s underworld needs a message delivered. Choose your path.”

Option.text: Tell me more of the Dust-Eater quest.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Deliver this sealed scroll to the Undermarket’s Shadowmaster. Say nothing, and take no coin until it’s done. Return with proof and I’ll pay double.”
[You have received a Faction Delivery Quest!]

Zara shifts slightly, her eyes narrowing—not with hostility, but with the weight of remembering.

“You want to know the Ghost Blade?” She chuckles dryly. “Few ask. Fewer survive the answers. But if you’ve the spine for ghosts and grit, then ask.”

She leans forward. “Choose a thread, and I’ll unspool it.”

Option.text: What's the most dangerous thing you've done?
I'd like to ask something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“A tent, a dagger, and a fire. That was my cradle. I was born in the dunes of a dead province now swallowed by the Ash Serpents. My people were blades-for-hire, even before I could walk.

I was blooded at twelve. My first kill was a man who tried to ransom my sister. I kept the ransom coin and the knife.”

She tosses a dull silver coin into your hand.
[You have received a Coin of Ghost Memory.]

Option.text: You did what had to be done.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara shrugs.
“So is war. So is love. So is Qasaria in summer.”

“What else do you burn to know?”

She nods approvingly.
“You understand. The knife was cleaner than what he planned. And the coin... I kept to remember how small death can be.”

“What else do you burn to know?”

A rare softness flickers in her expression.

“I once loved a sword-dancer from Skara Brae. Her name was Elire. We trained together, fought together… even defied the council of Trinsic together. But war doesn’t love us back.

She died to a shadowcurse meant for me.”
Zara exhales, steadying herself. “Every time I kill a servant of Minax, I whisper Elire’s name.”

Option.text: She must have been worth remembering.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara studies you for a moment, then nods.

“His name was Kael, a mercenary like me. He taught me to dance with a blade and sing like a bird. He died like a fool—charging a fireball with nothing but honor in his heart.

I’ve hated him for that. And missed him every battle since.”
She chuckles. “I still wear his ring... but never on my sword hand.”

Option.text: That’s the price of loving warriors.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara sits on a broken marble bench, eyes drifting toward the Qasarian skyline.

“I believe in honor without allegiance. I believe in keeping your word, even when no one's watching. I believe that blades sing truth louder than banners.

And I believe Minax must be broken—not just beaten, but unmade, her name forgotten even by ghosts.”

Option.text: Then we are aligned in purpose.
Beliefs like that get you killed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps. But I’d rather die for my code than live for someone else’s cowardice.”

“What else do you want to know?”

Zara’s smile returns, sharp and dangerous.

“I once infiltrated a Minax fortress by pretending to be one of her acolytes. Drank poison, wore ash robes, chanted nonsense for two days. Stole her map of the shattered Gem before their high priest noticed I was breathing properly.”

She grins. “Still have the map... but I’d only share it with someone I trust.”

Option.text: I’ve proven my worth, haven’t I?
What would it take to earn that trust?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara eyes your fingers. “Hmm. Nimble enough. You’d have slipped it without a ripple.”

She hands you a rolled scrap sealed with a silver rune.
[You have received: Fragment of Minax's Shard Map]

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll guard it well.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zara’s eyes glint mischievously.

“Trust is earned blade-first. Bring me the *Bandit Emblem* from the Ash Serpents’ hideout north of the Tomb of Sorrow. It marks their elite. Bring me that, and I’ll share the map.”

[New Quest Objective: Slay an Ash Serpent Captain and retrieve the Bandit Emblem.]
